sentences.en: He is the landlord of this pub.
He left what little furniture he owned to his landlord in lieu of rent.
sentences.cn: 他把自己仅有的那点家具留给了房东抵房租。

sentences.en: He was in an argument with his landlord downstairs.
sentences.cn: 他与楼下的房东发生了争执。

sentences.en: He was square with his landlord.

sentences.cn: 他的房东把租金提高了一倍。

sentences.en: Kara is meeting with the landlord, Mr. Li.
sentences.cn: 卡拉和房东李先生碰了面.

sentences.en: Larry's landlord threatened not to renew his lease.
sentences.cn: 拉里的房东威胁说不跟他续租。

sentences.en: Regulations placed clear obligations on the landlord for the benefit of the tenant.
sentences.cn: 为维护房客的利益，条例明确规定了房东负有的各项义务。

sentences.en: The house has an absentee landlord , who visits the property once a year.
sentences.cn: 这栋房子的房主不在这儿住, 一年过来一次.

sentences.en: The landlord gave notice of the termination of tenancy.
sentences.cn: 房东给了租期终止的通知.

sentences.en: The landlord gave us a drink on the house.
sentences.cn: 店主免费为我们供应了一杯饮料.

sentences.en: The landlord had let the building fall into decay .
sentences.cn: 房东不管，房子已经破烂不堪。

sentences.en: The landlord has imposed a severe stress on the poor tenants.
sentences.cn: 房东给这些可怜的房客们加了很大的压力.

sentences.en: The landlord is doing my apartment over.
sentences.cn: 房东正在翻修我的房子.

sentences.en: The landlord refused to serve him because he considered him too drunk.
sentences.cn: 酒吧老板觉得他已经喝多了，拒绝再给他添酒。

trans.tran_en: a man who rents a room, building, or piece of land to someone
